Common

mvdatasets.geometry.common.convert_6d_to_rotation_matrix(d6: Tensor) → Tensor

Converts 6D rotation representation by Zhou et al. [ZBL+19] to rotation matrix using Gram-Schmidt orthogonalization per Section B. Adapted from pytorch3d. :param d6: 6D rotation representation (…, 6)

Returns:

batch of rotation matrices of size (…, 3, 3)

mvdatasets.geometry.common.deg2rad(deg: float | ndarray | Tensor) → float | ndarray | Tensor
mvdatasets.geometry.common.euclidean_to_homogeneous(points: ndarray | Tensor) → ndarray | Tensor

Converts Euclidean coordinates to homogeneous coordinates by appending a column of ones.

Parameters:

points (np.ndarray or torch.Tensor) – A 2D array of shape (N, C) representing Euclidean points.

Returns:

A 2D array of shape (N, C+1) in homogeneous coordinates.

Return type:

np.ndarray or torch.Tensor

Raises:

  • TypeError – If points is not a NumPy array or PyTorch tensor.

  • ValueError – If points is not a 2D array.

mvdatasets.geometry.common.get_mask_points_in_image_range(points_2d_screen: ndarray | Tensor, width: int, height: int) → ndarray | Tensor

Filter out points that are outside the image.

mvdatasets.geometry.common.get_min_max_cameras_distances(poses: list) → tuple

return maximum pose distance from origin

Parameters:

poses (list) – list of numpy (4, 4) poses

Returns:

minumum camera distance from origin max_dist (float): maximum camera distance from origin

Return type:

min_dist (float)

mvdatasets.geometry.common.homogeneous_to_euclidean(vectors: ndarray | Tensor) → ndarray | Tensor

Converts homogeneous coordinates to Euclidean coordinates by dividing by the last coordinate.

Parameters:

vectors (np.ndarray or torch.Tensor) – An (N, C+1) array of homogeneous coordinates.

Returns:

An (N, C) array of Euclidean coordinates.

Return type:

np.ndarray or torch.Tensor

Raises:

ValueError – If the input does not have at least two dimensions or if vectors is not a NumPy array or PyTorch tensor.

mvdatasets.geometry.common.look_at(eye, center, up)

Compute camera pose from look-at vectors (OpenCV format).

Parameters:

  • eye (np.ndarray) – (3,) Camera position in world space.

  • center (np.ndarray) – (3,) Point to look at in world space.

  • up (np.ndarray) – (3,) Up vector.

Returns:

(4, 4) Camera pose matrix.

Return type:

np.ndarray

mvdatasets.geometry.common.opengl_matrix_world_from_w2c(w2c: ndarray) → ndarray

Convert OpenCV camera-to-world pose to OpenGL camera pose.

Args: - w2c: A 4x4 np.ndarray representing the OpenCV world-to-camera pose.

Returns: - A 4x4 np.ndarray representing the OpenGL camera pose.

mvdatasets.geometry.common.rotation_matrix(a: ndarray, b: ndarray) → ndarray

Compute the rotation matrix that rotates vector a to vector b.

Parameters:

  • a – The vector to rotate.

  • b – The vector to rotate to.

Returns:

The rotation matrix.
